pullRequest.body:
Introduce two predicates `P_Ïƒ` and `P_Î´` on morphisms in `SimplexCategoryGenRel`:
 - `P_Ïƒ` is defined as the `multiplicativeClosure` of degeneracies
 - `P_Î´` is defined as the `multiplicativeClosure` of faces

A subsequent pull request will show that every morphism in `SimplexCategoryGenRel` factors as a `P_Ïƒ` followed by a `P_Î´`.

Part of a series of PR formalising that `SimplexCategoryGenRel` is equivalent to `SimplexCategory`.

---

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> List.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

</details>

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/13399743692/job/37427465541)
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/13399743692/job/37427465861)

```suggestion
def splitMonoÎ´ {n : â„•} {i : Fin (n + 2)} : SplitMono (Î´ i) where
```

```suggestion
def splitEpiÏƒ {n : â„•} {i : Fin (n + 1)} : SplitEpi (Ïƒ i) where
```

```suggestion
lemma isSplitEpi_P_Ïƒ_toSimplexCategory {x y : SimplexCategoryGenRel} {e : x âŸ¶ y} (he : P_Ïƒ e) :
    IsSplitEpi <| toSimplexCategory.map e := by
```

```suggestion
def splitMonoÎ´ {n : â„•} (i : Fin (n + 2)) : SplitMono (Î´ i) where
```

```suggestion
def splitEpiÏƒ {n : â„•} (i : Fin (n + 1)) : SplitEpi (Ïƒ i) where
```
Infix operators like `<;>` should be put before the line break.

Mathlib uses more US-english than UK-english.
```suggestion
/-! # Epi-mono factorization in the simplex category presented by generators and relations
```
There are other occurrences below.

This may be a slightly better name:
```suggestion
lemma isSplitEpi_toSimplexCategory_map_of_P_Ïƒ {x y : SimplexCategoryGenRel} {e : x âŸ¶ y} (he : P_Ïƒ e) :
```
Could you fix these names? (In the naming conventions, `of_P_Ïƒ` would refer to the assumption `P_Ïƒ e`, and `toSimplexCategory_map` refers to the `map` field of the functor.)
Oh right, I went a bit too fast in f52ef73, apologies.
